name: Large Purple Bladderwort

Identifying Characteristics: Stems: slender, flaccid, medium size (up to 1m)
Leaves: finely branch divided thread-like, strict whorl arrangement
Flowers: midsummer, pale purple snapdragon-like on slender stalks, several flowers per stalk
Other: tiny lopsided sack-like bladders (used to capture prey) attached directly to tips of leaves, carnivorous: capture small prey such as zooplankton or small insects
Habitat: Lakes, ponds, slow-moving streams, wetland pools
Range: Native Range: Maine, much of New England, some other parts of the United States

tags: plants with finely-divided leaves on stems
